TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableCellStructure extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.SemanticBasicElement implements class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.BlockElement>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Represents a cell in a table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableRowStructure> can be the parent of a TableCellStructure.
## Examples The following example shows the `<TableCellStructure>` part of an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] document.
[!code-xml[DocumentStructure#DocStructTableStruct1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/DocumentStructure/Content/FixedPage1_structure.xaml#docstructtablestruct1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.BlockElement element) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a block element to the table cell.
Gets or sets the number of columns spanned by the cell.
Docs.value: The number of columns that the cell spans. The default is 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows spanned by the cell.
Docs.value: The number of rows that the cell spans. The default is 1.

.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddChild(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a child object to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableCellStructure> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
Every <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableCellStructure> must have at least one child. Typically, a child is a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ParagraphStructure>, but it can be a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.FigureStructure>, or a (nested) <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableStructure>.

Docs.exception: is not one of the types that can be a child of this class. See **Remarks**.
